QAPair.Question: Do you have information about Ventriculoperitoneal shunt - discharge
QAPair.Answer: Your child has hydrocephalus and a shunt was placed to drain excess fluid and relieve pressure in the brain. This buildup of brain fluid (cerebrospinal fluid, or CSF) causes the brain tissue to press (become compressed) against the skull. Too much pressure or pressure that is present for too long can damage the brain tissue. After your child goes home, follow the health care provider's instructions on how to care for your child.
